reason.tex: %text A relation $R$ in a set $A$ is said to be an $equivalence$ $relation$ if $R$ is reflexive, symmetric and transitive. % \begin{tabular}{|ll|} \hline reflexive & (a,a) \in R, \forall\, a\in A, \\ symmetric & (a_1,a_2)\in R \implies (a_2,a_1)\in R \\ & \quad\forall\, a_1, a_2\, \in R, \\ transitive & (a_1, a_2)\in R \text{ and }(a_2,a_3)\in R \\ & \quad \implies (a_1, a_3) \in R, \forall a_1,a_2,a_3 \in R \\ \hline \end{tabular}
